content.description: Sit start with hands in the crack and a foot on the exposed edge of the crack. Bump into the crack throwing all sizes of jams as you progress up the widening slabby crack.
content.location: This is the opposite side of the splitter crack that is Cracker Jax.Â

content.description: Climb the cool face with the scalloped edges, or tall/compression it. Both challenging.
content.location: From the Kettle pond day use parking area, blast into the woods just behind the information signage. Head uphill, trending left. You'll come upon the Sliced boulder in 5-10min of hiking, opposite to Cracker Jax. This V6-7 is on the downhill side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb the beautiful offwidth crack to a tricky topout.
content.location: From the Kettle pond day use parking area, blast into the woods just behind the information signage. Head uphill, trending left. You'll come upon the Sliced boulder in 5-10min of hiking, opposite to Cracker Jax.

content.description:
Just a perfect line. This might be the best line of its grade (V6 or V7) at Groton. 

  Grab a couple of weird opposing sidepulls and crappy feet. Traverse left and uphill a bit on side pulls and then hit a hard left hand gaston then a sloping crimp rail and eventually the top. Four stars!
content.location: After about 100 yards on the right hand Kettle Pond trail cut up hill and you should be able to find it about 50 - 70 yards up hill or so.

content.description: Some really nice problems up the hill side. Potential for FA's (with some lichen cleaning) still exists...
